away in a volcano that none dared
approach. She had no visitors, but
also avoided her hated farewells.

誰也不會靠近的火山深處生活。
這裡不會有小小的生命造訪，
也不會有她最討厭的分離。

context.en_us:
The years passed in solitude, and
the Flamewyrm's memories of her
friend faded until they seemed only
a distant dream—which was exactly
how she wished it to be.

与遥远过去的红色伙伴的邂逅

感觉就像是漫长的孤独之中
偶然做的一个短暂的梦。
也许是自己的一厢情愿。
context.zh_tw:
很久很久以前與紅色夥伴的相遇，
不知不覺亦隨時光流逝黯然失色。
那段日子感覺就像是在
永恆孤獨中掠過的一場夢。
──要是能當作是夢一場……

context.en_us:
Ages elapsed, and the shape of the
land itself shifted. There seemed no
creature of merit to the immortal
Flamewyrm.

但是對於永生的緋龍來說
世上一切的事物或許都沒有價值。

context.en_us:
But one day, her ears perked to
whispers of a human king, Alberius, 
to whom ancient dragons had been
swearing allegiance.

她听说了一件事：
名叫阿尔贝琉斯的人类的王
得到了许多古代龙的帮助。

有許多古老龍族紛紛

借給了名為阿爾博流斯的人類王者。

context.en_us:
The Flamewyrm traveled to the
Windwyrm's nest. ＂Why aid them?＂
she asked. ＂It is foolishness! All they
do is scrabble about and then perish.
They are nothing like us!＂

<ruby><rb>緋竜</rb><rt>ひりゅう</rt></ruby>は<ruby><rb>碧竜</rb><rt>へきりゅう</rt></ruby>の<ruby><rb>巣</rb><rt>す</rt></ruby>へ<ruby><rb>行</rb><rt>い</rt></ruby>って<ruby><rb>尋</rb><rt>たず</rt></ruby>ねた。

绯龙找到碧龙问他：
“你为什么帮助人类？
明明他们很快就会死。
实在是太愚蠢了。
他们和我们完全不同。”
context.zh_tw:
緋龍便到碧龍的巢穴詢問。
「為什麼要把力量借給人類？
反正他們很快就會死去，
這樣做實在太愚蠢了。
人類和我們完全不一樣啊。」

context.en_us:
The Windwyrm smiled. ＂That is for the
best. Short-lived they may be, but
they leave their mark upon the
world. They are...beautiful.＂

「<ruby><rb>違</rb><rt>ちが</rt></ruby>うからよいのだ」
<ruby><rb>碧竜</rb><rt>へきりゅう</rt></ruby>は<ruby><rb>笑</rb><rt>わら</rt></ruby>った。

<ruby><rb>美</rb><rt>うつく</rt></ruby>しきものよ」
context.zh_cn:
“正因为不同才好。”
碧龙笑了。
“即使生命短暂也要生子、
继承遗志，在世间留下痕迹。
这是何等美好啊。”
context.zh_tw:
「正因不同才好。」
碧龍笑道。
「縱然生命短暫，亦會養育子嗣
以傳承其意志，將痕跡留於世間，
此為何等美好之事。」

At this the Flamewyrm scoffed,
though she was beset with thoughts
of the small butterfly she befriended
all those many years ago.

「不懂你說什麼！」
當緋龍這麼說的同時，

與那小小蝴蝶相遇的過往。

context.en_us: The sight of her fluttering through the\nair truly WAS beautiful...

Rearing her head, the Flamewyrm
saw a swarm of butterflies in the field,

those of her long-gone friend.

At this, she suddenly wondered if her
friend had left a mark upon the world
after all. For it seemed her life—and
those of all creatures—wove together
over time to form a greater tapestry.

context.en_us: Perhaps small creatures were just as\ndeserving of the respect they showed\nto those larger than themselves.

對偉大生物抱持著敬意一般，

也該珍惜渺小生物的短暫生命。

It would be some time until the
Flamewyrm came around.

prince...
